page.title: 01 HIGH MURDIESTON FARM
page.content: { THE HIGH MURDIESTON FARM IS OWNED BY {MR BARBOUR AND IT IS MAINLY A SHEEP {FARM. THERE ARE 800 EWES ON THE FARM, {AND THEY ALSO HAVE SOME SUCKLING COWS. { IT IS A FAMILY FARM, HIS WIFE,SON AND {DAUGHTER HELP HIM AT THE BUSY TIMES OF {THE YEAR. CALVING TAKES PLACE BETWEEN {FEBRUARY AND MARCH, LAMBING TAKES {PLACE DURING APRIL AND MAY AND THESE {ARE TIMES OF THE YEAR WHEN HE IS VERY {BUSY. DURING JUNE HE MAY BE WORKING {FROM 6am TO 9pm SHEARING, DIPPING AND {MARKING THE SHEEP. { WHEN HE HAS TROUBLE WITH DOGS WORRY- {ING THE SHEEP HE IS ENTITLED TO SHOOT {THEM. EWES CARRYING TWIN LAMBS ARE {WORTH ABOUT Â£50. IN THE AUTUMN HE {SELLS THE SHEEP AND CATTLE AT THE {PAISLEY MARKET,THE LAMBS ARE FOR {SLAUGHTER AND THE CALVES GO TO OTHER {FARMS FOR FATTENING. { }
